results.title: The XPT East Coast journey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
On the Express Passenger Train- Australia’s fastest train, travel from Brisbane in subtropical Queensland to cosmopolitan Sydney in the heart of New South Wales. Cross the rugged Macpherson ranges, tour Australia’s economic heartland and visit the country’s pristine beaches. The XPT even cruises through some alternative villages and through Australia’s spectacular rainforests. As the train pulls into one of its 21 stops, Coff’s Harbour, view the vast plantations of bananas as well as the gaudy “Big Banana” tourist park, which symbolizes the recent tourism boom. Finally, the XPT reaches Sydney. Hugging the shores of a magnificent harbor and accented by its elegant bridge, Sydney is the quintessential icon of the Australian experience.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.

results.title: Tweekage
results.brief_description: Skateboard enthusiasts will enjoy this hour of footage recording some of Australia’s top skaters performing impressive moves; kick flipping, sliding and grinding across Sydney, Melbourne, the Gold Coast and major skating events. For those of you who don’t skate you may be inspired to give it a try, although the SLAM section illustrates that even professionals are prone to hurting themselves. Good camera work puts the viewer right into the heart of the action and provides an adrenaline rush.

results.title: The Madigan Line
results.brief_description: One of the most inhospitable and desolate regions on Earth, the Simpson Desert was to fight off many challenges to penetrate its seemingly impenetrable heart. Expedition after expedition tried and failed. Men died but still they came. This video faithfully reenacts the 1939 expedition of Dr. Cecil Madigan who successfully crossed Australias last frontier.

results.title: Boys and Balls
results.creator_credit: Sue Thomson, Anna Grieve, Thermal Falls, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gil Scrine Films
results.brief_description: It is in games many men discover their paradise. Robert Lynd. H.G. Nelson (Greig Pickhaver) and Rampaging Roy Slaven (John Doyle) host an amusing, often hilarious exploration of the fascination of men with balls; whether it is a cricket, football, tennis, basketball, soccer, bowls, table tennis, hockey or golf ball! Celebrities including Ted Whitten, Ron Barassi, Merv Hughes, Derek Kickett, Andrew Gaze, Lindsay Gaze, Francis Awaritife, Brad Mackay, Greg Champion and the average bloke and kid next door share favourite childhood memories of their sporting idols, humerous moments, coaching temperaments, the importance of rules and umpiring, and the incidence of sporting violence. Interviews, archival footage and famous quotes are intermixed in this perceptive program.

results.title: Shadow on the reef. Turning turtle.
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and Orana Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blue wilderness”.
“Shadow on the reef” looks at the incredible Whale Shark, the world’s largest shark. Valerie and Ron Taylor explore the wonders of the deep below the coral reef, emphasising the message that this fragile ecology is increasingly under threat.
“Turning Turtle” sees Ron and Valerie Taylor at odds with the Queensland Government over the fate of turtles on coral islands, with a focus on Raine Island. The Green Turtles are a rare and ancient species and the fight to save them pits the Taylors against bureaucracy and harsh physical conditions.

results.title: Artists in cyberculture
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Cohen, Frances McGivern and Cracked Metal Productions
results.brief_description: Artists record their work at the Third International Symposium on Electronic Art, Sydney, 1992. Through a series of interviews, performance, electronic theatre, this video looks at ways in which artists challenge the emerging technological realm known as “cyberculture”. It also examines issues such as gender, the body, the homogenisation of culture and the social and environmental implications of new technologies. Three of the artists interviewed are Char Davies, Stelarc and Myron Kreuger.

results.title: Concrete city
results.creator_credit: Frontyard Films, Mandy King and Fabio Cavadini
results.brief_description: This thought-provoking film about a small community of working class people who live in the old wharfside Sydney suburb of Pyrmont, brings into question the notion of coummunity participation in major urban development schemes. The development, in this case, involves nothing less than the total destruction of a community and of valuable heritage sites, for the construction of a casino and a whole range of high rise commercial development. The community is “consulted” and “involved”, yet their own suggestions as to how best develop the area are largely ignored.

results.title: 1993 World solar challenge
results.creator_credit: GMH, Monash University. Mechanical Engineering, Caulfield and Don Scutt
results.brief_description: Covers the 1993 Daido Hoxan World Solar Challenge, a race by solar powered cars from Darwin to Adelaide over 3000 kilometres. Includes interviews with the leading teams and technical experts.

results.title: Spitfire over Australia
results.brief_description: During World War II, more than 650 Spitfire aircraft were delivered to the RAAF. This is the story of Colin Pay, who rebuilt one of those magnificent machines, a Vickers Supermarine Spitfire HF Mk VIII built in 1944, from the corroded hulk he acquired in 1982. It is now a superbly restored flying machine. Including some of the best air to air colour footage ever shot of a Spitfire in Australia, and archival footage of Spitfires in Darwin in 1943 and interviews with the pilots who originally flew them, this is the ideal video for avaition enthusiasts!
